text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Shailan Lala.

I am a Software
Development Manager at AWS.

I work on a storage
service called Amazon Fsx,

and I have been at AWS for
just under three years.
(upbeat music)
I've always been interested in technology,
studied computer science.
I worked at two companies prior to AWS,
where I actually focused

on building software that
landed in private data centers,

and that got me really
interested in how AWS works.

And I really wanted to see
what it looks like behind

the scenes on how to
actually build the service.
(upbeat music)

I had a lot of preconceptions
that I would be out
of my depth,

and I quickly learned that
there's enough process

and rigor around how we
onboard, how we ramp people up,
that within a period of weeks to months,
depending on the person,
you actually become really comfortable
and you become a contributor, so.
(upbeat music)
My favorite moment or proudest moment
at AWS is always launching a new feature
or a product.
Every single time I read a public post

about that new feature
that my team just launched,
it is always my proudest moment.
(upbeat music)
For me, it's always about connecting AWS

with the greater worlds
or the greater good.

From the technical work,
which I absolutely love,

Amazon has been heavily invested
in inclusion and diversity.

As a hiring manager, I
have actually gone through
inclusion training and diversity training,
and we're always looking to make sure
that when we build our teams,

we are diverse across
many different spectrums
so that we're building a team that is rich

in terms of backgrounds
and sort of thoughts.
And one great example

of that is we actually
hire quite a few folks

that don't have traditional
computer science backgrounds,

which is really exciting and
relatively new in the industry,

and I absolutely love that
we're doing something like that.
(upbeat music)
